meanings.definition: To set or establish boundaries or limits.
meanings.sent1: She used a ruler to demark the edges of the paper.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to demark their personal space.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to demark its territory by scratching the fence.
meanings.sent4: The demarked line on the map showed where the property ended.
meanings.sent5: The demarked area was clearly labeled with a sign.

meanings.sent1: The colors on the flag demark different countries.
meanings.sent2: The chef used herbs to demark the flavors in the dish.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to demark the truth from the lies.
meanings.sent4: Her unique style demarked her from the rest of the group.
meanings.sent5: The demarked sections in the document made it easier to read.

meanings.definition: A boundary or limit that is set or established.
meanings.sent1: The fence acted as a demark between the two properties.
meanings.sent2: The demark between work and play is important for a balanced life.
meanings.sent3: The demark of the river was where the water changed color.
meanings.sent4: The demark of the forest was where the trees thinned out.
meanings.sent5: The demark of the city was the tall buildings on the horizon.
